title: September is the worst month for stocks — and it’s even gloomier after a downbeat August
text:
August is typically a weak month for stock market performance, and September is the only month that, on average, is worse for equity-market prices See full story.

Tesla’s unveiling of a pickup truck is right around the corner

CEO Elon Musk said the electric pickup truck will rival both the Porsche 911 sports car and the standard bearer Ford F-150 pickup. See full story.

When LeBron James chose Nike in 2003, he gave up $28 million — it could end up making him $1 billion

A look at the 4 best financial decisions LeBron James has made. See full story.

Everything coming to Netflix in September — and what’s leaving

Netflix Inc. is ushering in the fall with plenty of screen favorites and binge-friendly originals. See full story.

The trade war is flooding the U.S. with soybeans — luckily, they could be better for us than we thought

Soy protein is a better choice than animal-derived proteins, says one Harvard researcher. See full story.

The global obesity epidemic is also an environmental catastrophe, scientists have warned. See full story.
description: August is typically a weak month for stock market performance, and September is the only month that, on average, is worse for equity-market prices
